sources.title: I Lived with You
sources.description: Title: I Lived with You Summary: In London a young lady meets a homeless and apparently penniless Russian prince. She introduces him to her middle-class Fulham family and he moves in. It turns out he still has a number of ... Directed by: Maurice Elvey Actors: Ursula Jeans, Ida Lupino, Minnie Rayner Production Company: Gaumont British Picture Corporation Release Date: 14 June 1933 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 In London a young lady meets a homeless and apparently penniless Russian prince. She introduces him to her middle-class Fulham family and he moves in. It turns out he still has a number of diamonds given him by the last czar, and he is persuaded to start selling them. The resulting money, and his princely notoriety, soon cause changes in everyone's lives.

metadata.Plot: In London a young lady meets a homeless and apparently penniless Russian prince. She introduces him to her middle-class Fulham family and he moves in. It turns out he still has a number of diamonds given him by the last czar, and he is persuaded to start selling them. The resulting money, and his princely notoriety, soon cause changes in everyone's lives.
metadata.Writer: Ivor Novello, George A. Cooper, H. Fowler Mear
metadata.Actors: Ursula Jeans, Ida Lupino, Minnie Rayner
